scheduler

Class Cache

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.Cache
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LFUCache, LRUCache, NoCache

    public abstract class Cache
extends java.lang.Object
    Cache class is used for caching system. It has a vector where data is stored using ProcessCached class. If a value is stored, the it will not be computed next time. This increases performance for big numbers.
    Author:
    razvan

    • Method Detail

      • runProcessUsingCache

        public boolean runProcessUsingCache(Process p)
        Run a process and check it was called before. If yes, find the value from cache, otherwise run the process and store the value in cache.
        Parameters:
        p - the process which is going to be running
        Returns:
        whether or not the value was calculated before (cached)

      • getCachedValue

        private java.lang.Integer getCachedValue(Process p)
        Find the value in cache and return it if it's found. Otherwise, return null.
        Parameters:
        p - the process which is going to be running
        Returns:
        the value from cache or null if is not there

      • cacheValue

        private void cacheValue(Process p)
        Cache a process with its value. If the cache is not full, will place the process there, otherwise will rewrite an old one.
        Parameters:
        p - the process which will be cached

      • updateCache

        protected abstract void updateCache(Process p)
        Update the cache when it is full. The caching policy is given by type of cache.
        Parameters:
        p - a process which will be added in cache

      • getCache

        protected ProcessCached[] getCache()
        Returns:
        the cache of processes and values

      • getCrtLen

        protected int getCrtLen()
        Getter for crtLen.
        Returns:
        return the current number of values in cache
